Posts.Content: Nov 30, 2008 05:29AM HopeForBest wrote: Dear All, It is amazing how this BC brings us together. It is a tough situation for all of us and hope GOD will give us patience and resistance against all these chemos and the power to defeat this disease. I had my BLT Mast on 17 Nov. My surgeon said I  had Grade 3 Cancer bigger than 5 cm. He believes I should get chemo and rad. I have an appointment with my Oncologist on 6 Dec. I do not know anything about my HER2, Oncotype test etc. I believe my Oncologist is gone tell me. I am worried about everything. Especially not knowing what is gone happen. I wanted to put Port already. How long the surgery for port take. I believe it is easier to have it. Anyway, so many things to worry. All the best to ALL and will check on you. Hope
Posts.Title: Has anyone started a forum for Chemo in Dec 2008? horsercn Texas357

Anyway, I will know exactly on Dec. 6. Happy Thanksgiving to you too.

Posts.Title: Surgery's over, Now what? Firni lktracey

Posts.Content: Nov 27, 2008 04:13PM HopeForBest wrote: Hello Ladies, I want to share with my friendsabout my day. Am 10 days post BLT Mast and started to drive around. It is amazing how fast we can adapt with things we thought impossible. I am getting used to myself with out breasts. I still have mild pain. The skin they left on both sides is bothering too. I have appointment with my Onc on 6 December. The path report i received from my surgeon says it is OK. Sentinels both sides are negatif, margins clear. But the cancer they removed is quite big. Am not sure about HER2. I will know more from my oncologist. But I wish I could know whether chemo is in for me or not. Is it the HER2 which identifies about this. Am not sure whome to ask before my appointment on 6 Dec. With best wishes to All. Hope to hear from you. Hope

Posts.Content: HopeForBest wrote: Hello everyone, It is so calming to read your posts here. I am a candidate for bilateral mastescomy for next Monday, 17 November. I just had biopsy of both breasts. Initially, I was told LICS on the riht and on the left was some lump non cancerous. After the biopsy am told now both breasts have cancer invasive, group 3 and I have to do biletral. My surgeon said I will need also chemo and rad too. I feel so terriable. I can not imagine how I should go through this. Am scared...Appreciate any advice, feedback etc. PS: Am single mom of two young children . Log in to post a reply
